cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles south of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward just offshore of the U.S. Mid-Atlantic coast toward New England and Nova Scotia

weather_observation.warning_coast: North Carolina/Virginia border to Fenwick Island DE, including lower Chesapeake Bay and tidal Potomac
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Carolina coast northward along the Mid-Atlantic shoreline into southeastern New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Low-end tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible Friday as Dorian passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge forecast for Delaware Bay or Wilmington wharf area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain may bring 1–3 inches with brief heavy downpours Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough surf and dangerous rip currents near the Delaware beaches; minor river rises possible from upstream rainfall.
